definition: to worry/to feel anxious/Taiwan pr. [zhao1 ji2]
to touch/to come in contact with/to feel/to be affected by/to catch fire/to burn/(coll.) to fall asleep/(after a verb) hitting the mark/succeeding in
aspect particle indicating action in progress

sentences.english: Eight sister think four xi died, worry and sad.
sentences.chinese: 八妹以为四喜死了，又着急又伤心。

sentences.english: The people around looked at him in anxiety.
sentences.chinese: 周围的人看着他，干着急。

sentences.english: By that time Tina and Max were beginning to feel less anxious.
sentences.chinese: 这时蒂娜和迈克斯渐渐开始感到不那么着急了。

sentences.english: Don't worry. The next section will show how to add displayable content.
sentences.chinese: 别着急，下一节将说明如何添加可显示的内容。

sentences.english: Calm down, please tell me your address in detail.
sentences.chinese: 别着急，请告诉我们您的具体地址。

sentences.english: Don't hurry, the best always come out casualness.
sentences.chinese: 不要着急，最好的总会在最不经意的时候出现。

sentences.english: I suddenly felt very worried, but could not say anything.
sentences.chinese: 我突然非常着急起来，但却什么也说不出来。

sentences.english: The light was failing, and he needed to return to camp before his colleagues started to worry.
sentences.chinese: 天暗了下来，他得先赶回营地，免得同事着急。

sentences.english: Don't worry about it. It seems to me that you always do better than you say.
sentences.chinese: 别着急，在我看来每次你的考试结果都比你说的要好。

sentences.english: Han Lengyan immediately anxious people, ready to rescue.
sentences.chinese: 韩冷烟立刻着急人马，准备去救人。

sentences.english: But Ziyun hadn't come back, which worried the family very much.
sentences.chinese: 可是紫云一直没回来，家里人着急不已。

sentences.english: Listening to the teacher worried of inquiry, leap or my sit at the same table told her reasoning.
sentences.chinese: 听着闫老师着急的询问，还是我的同桌告诉了她原委。

sentences.english: Father and son 2 people worry search HanShan and willow thin waists.
sentences.chinese: 父子二人着急地寻觅韩珊和柳细腰。

sentences.english: I’m so worried because I can’t make myself understand.
sentences.chinese: 我很着急，因为我无法让他们懂我的意思。

definition: to get panicky/to lose one's head/(coll.) (after 得) unbearably/terribly
happy/glad/willing (to do sth)/in a cheerful mood
to worry/to fret/to be anxious/to become sad
